intro: Agathosma stipitata, commonly known as Cape Geranium, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their antispasmodic and anti-inflammatory properties. The species is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
